alert.note: Alert for Kemper; Lauderdale (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 26 at 6:58PM CDT until March 26 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN KEMPER...NORTHERN CLARKE AND LAUDERDALE COUNTIES... At 658 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Prismatic to Nellieburg to 6 miles northwest of Stonewall, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Lauderdale, Meridian, Meridian Station, Marion, Stonewall, Zero, Blackwater, Tamola, Increase, Martin, Meehan, Toomsuba, Prismatic, Savoy, Suqualena, Kewanee, Snell, Nellieburg, Sable and Alamucha. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for east central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
